title: Western buyers diverting RMG orders to Bangladesh’s competitors as unrest disrupts production

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Last week, the five factories of Asrotex Group, an export-focused garment manufacturing company, could only achieve 19 percent of their production target. The ongoing worker unrest is making it impossible for them to fulfil the purchase orders they have for the next three months.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: The Group’s Managing Director Asadul Islam expressed his helplessness to bdnews24.com, saying that if the situation continues like this, they may have to consider closing the factories entirely.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: “The workers aren’t listening to us. We have to follow their demands. We’ve declared a three-day layoff, yet the workers are demanding wages for those days too,” he said.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Asadul referred to the workers' demands as "daylight robbery".

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Asrotex, which employs around 21,000 workers, exports garments worth $15 to $16 million every month. However, in September, the workers only worked 16 out of the 26 scheduled working days.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: He also said that they are now taking bank loans to pay the workers’ wages. "How long will the banks keep lending us money? We’re seriously thinking about closing down the factories. If this continues, we have no other option."

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: This situation isn't limited to Asrotex alone.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Many other large companies in the sector are facing the same fate due to worker unrest. Amid deteriorating law and order following the change in power, worker dissatisfaction, protests, strikes, and factory closures are raising serious concerns about the future of this sector, which contributes around 85 percent of the country’s export earnings.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: With production plummeting, orders shifting to neighbouring countries, revenues shrinking, and dependence on bank loans increasing, many large companies in the garment sector are now facing the risk of permanent closure.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: There are around 2,800 garment factories in the country directly involved in garment exports.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: On Sept 12, due to the continuous worker unrest and unstable conditions, authorities declared an indefinite closure of 86 factories in the Ashulia industrial area and a general holiday for 133 factories.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: On the same day, a government press conference revealed that more than 50 factories had been shut down indefinitely. Every day, numerous factories remain closed, leading to the cancellation of garment orders.

description: GOVERNMENT ACKNOWLEDGES 20% ORDER CANCELLATIONS

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Amid worker unrest, approximately 15 to 20 percent of garment orders have been cancelled, Labour and Employment Advisor Asif Mahmud Shojib Bhuiyan said at a press conference on Sept 12.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: However, Asadul Islam, the Asrotex Group MD, expressed a greater concern beyond the decline in orders. "If things continue like this, the entire industry won’t survive," he said.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Shovon Islam, Managing Director of Sparrow Group of Industries, echoed similar concerns. His group exports garments to 40 buyer companies across 20 countries.

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Shovon told bdnews24.com, “Typically, buyers assume such problems will be resolved within 4-5 days, or at most a week. But more than a month has passed without any solution. We accepted the workers' 18 demands, but they keep adding more. It’s very disappointing.”

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: He warned that if the situation persists, the industry will face an "existential crisis".

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: “To be honest, orders don’t come overnight. Orders are booked three months in advance. But we are unable to produce. What’s the use of getting orders if we can't execute them?”

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: Shovon further added, “For 10-20 percent of the orders, buyers have already said they don’t need them anymore. Buyers are no longer negotiating new deals.”

newsitem: RMG buyers sending orders to competitors amid unrest
description: He also noted that while the worker unrest initially started in Ashulia, it is now "spreading to various parts of the country”.

China home sales rise
title: China home sales rise after stimulus measures, state media says

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: China's home sales rose during the National Day holiday after a string of property stimulus measures to boost the country's beleaguered real estate market since late September, state media said on Saturday.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: Across the world's second-largest economy, policies including reductions in down-payment ratios and mortgage rates have been introduced this year to support the property sector, which previously made up one-quarter of economic activity.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: During the week-long holiday period that started on Tuesday, the number of house visits, which reflects a willingness to buy a home, increased significantly while sales of homes in many places rose to "varying degrees", state broadcaster CCTV reported.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: More than 50 cities introduced policies to boost the real estate market, while nearly 2,000 developments from more than 1,000 property companies participated in promotions, CCTV said, citing the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: The number of visits to most of the projects participating in the promotions increased by more than 50% year-on-year, it added.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: In the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, many real estate sales offices worked through the night to lure home-buyers, and transaction volumes as well as the number of viewers to properties "increased significantly," the 21st Century Business Herald reported, without providing details.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: Some buyers drove long distances to see homes, it added.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: Last month, Guangzhou city in southern Guangdong province announced the lifting of all restrictions on home purchases, while Shanghai and Shenzhen said they would ease restrictions on housing purchases by non-local buyers and lower the minimum down-payment ratio for first home buyers to no less than 15%.

newsitem: China home sales rise
description: Those measures came days after China unveiled its biggest stimulus since the COVID-19 pandemic in a bid to pull the economy out of a deflationary funk.

title: Bangladesh leather sector businesses seek loan interest waiver

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: Leather sector traders have requested an opportunity for loan interest waiver during a meeting with the finance advisor.

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: On Sunday, the Bangladesh Finished Leather, Leather goods and Footwear Exporters' Association met Finance and Commerce Advisor Salehuddin Ahmed at the Secretariat.

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: The association’s Chief Advisor MA Rashid Bhuiyan told reporters, "We didn’t ask for money. We were moved from Hazaribagh to Savar. They declared those areas (Hazaribagh) as red zones. We couldn’t run our business there (in Savar).

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: “The CETP (Central Effluent Treatment Plant) is not functioning properly. The infrastructure is incomplete. We’ve informed the advisor about these issues. He has assured us that a solution will be provided."

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: When asked by journalists about the demands they presented, the business leader said, "Our demand is to fix the CETP. It’s because of them that we have been harmed. That's why we’ve asked for a waiver of the interest on our loans and to reschedule them."

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: Association Chairman Mohiuddin Ahmed Mahin said, “The companies in the BSCIC industrial city are 100 percent export-oriented. We have been given all kinds of licences for export. Due to the incomplete CETP, we are currently forced to sell to China at 70-80 percent less than the international market price. If we can increase the value addition, we will be able to go back to purchasing leather at the previous prices, such as Tk 2,000 in 2015-2016.”

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: He added, “The participation of tannery owners in the BSCIC industrial city was appropriate. The failure occurred due to the government organisation BSCIC. Therefore, in no way can the tannery owners be blamed for this failure. The finance advisor listened to us and assured us that the problems would be resolved.”

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: After the meeting, Advisor Salehuddin told reporters, “Today, we spoke with the leather, leather goods, and footwear exporters association. The leather sector is extremely important because of its significant demand both in exports and domestically."

newsitem: Leather traders seek loan interest waiver
description: “We’ve discussed various issues related to the sector’s potential and challenges. The tanneries have been relocated to Savar. We discussed environmental concerns, financing, and leather certification for exports,” the advisor said.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: Japan's development agency JICA has offered to inject new investments to enhance skills and increase employment in Bangladesh's information technology sector.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: A delegation led by Japan International Cooperation Agency's Chief Representative in Bangladesh, Ichiguchi Tomohide met Information and Communication Technology Advisor Nahid Islam at the Secretariat on Sunday to convey the interest.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: According to a press release from the ministry, Nahid told Tomohide that the interim government's primary goal is to reduce unemployment in the country by creating employment opportunities.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: Tomohide said, "Bangladesh has great potential in the information technology sector. However, there are limited opportunities for good jobs. We want to create new job opportunities in Bangladesh and, at the same time, train 1,000 IT engineers to capitalise on this potential."

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: Advisor Nahid said, "Creating employment is the main goal of the current government. The movement that took place was also driven by the need for employment. We welcome any investment from JICA that helps in creating jobs.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: "If there are specific proposals in this regard, they will be considered. The interim government expects more investment from Japan and JICA."

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: Tomohide said JICA is interested in working on two agendas: increasing investment and public administration reform.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: He also expressed interest in infrastructure development. Japan wants to assist Bangladesh in this area by utilising the experience gained from countries around the world.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs
description: The advisor said the interim government is trying to create a business-friendly environment in the country to encourage private sector investment.

newsitem: JICA keen to invest to generate IT jobs

newsitem: Google must open app store to competition: US judge
description: A US judge on Monday ordered Alphabet's Google to overhaul its mobile app business to give Android users more options to download apps and to pay for transactions within them, following a jury verdict last year for “Fortnite” maker Epic Games.

newsitem: Google must open app store to competition: US judge

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud
description: Acting US Attorney Joshua Levy said the defendants engaged in sham trades to artificially inflate the trading volume of various cryptocurrency tokens before selling them off, "leaving innocent investors holding the bag."

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud
description: "This is a case where new age technology, crypto, meets an old school fraud, in this case a 'pump and dump' scheme, which is as old as the stock markets," Levy told reporters.

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud
description: As part of the investigation, the FBI directed the creation of a cryptocurrency company, NexFundAI, which had a token on the Ethereum blockchain that prosecutors said ZM Quant, CLS Global and another company, MyTrade, agreed to help manipulate.

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

newsitem: US charges 3 companies with cryptocurrency fraud

title: Online shopping returns to growth in Europe amid fierce competition

newsitem: Online shopping returns to growth in Europe

newsitem: Online shopping returns to growth in Europe

newsitem: Online shopping returns to growth in Europe

newsitem: Online shopping returns to growth in Europe
